Posts.Content: Nov 15, 2012 12:34PM SusanAnn wrote: Hello Soleil  Just wanted to let you know that I went to UCLA for a second opinion and ended up having my surgery and reconstruction done there.  It was the best decision I ever made!  As far as choosing an oncologist, not sure who you spoke with but UCLA has a Multidisciplinary Program at The Revlon/UCLA Breast Center for people who have a recurrence or disease progression.  You can call them at (310) 825-2144.  Perhaps you can meet with an oncologist at the Westwood Campus and also the Irvine one and decide that way.  I know there are a few gals that have also gone to UCLA- and they may have some names for you.  UCLA can be overwhelming but once you are in the system, the care is wonderful.  I hope that I was able to help in some small way.
Posts.Title: Looking for a Great Southern California Onc soleil505 soleil505

Posts.Content: Dec 1, 2011 02:54PM SusanAnn wrote: I also had four treatments of cytoxin and taxotere with three weeks in between.  Around the third treatment I also noticed that my eyes were tearing up quite a lot.  Asked my MO but he had no idea what it was.  I decided to go to my ophthalmologist (sp?) and he told me it was due to the taxotere.  He put small, soft stents into my tear ducts (not sure what they are called).  You need to be put under as they attach them to the inside of your nose so they don't come out.  Its a little uncomfortable at first but I have had them in for about six months.  Have an apt to get them out  next week.  He did say when you get them out your tear ducts become a little larger than normal but that its not a problem. He also mentioned about scar tissue forming and that will lead to your eyes always tearing if you dont do anything.  Its not something  that happens to everyone and they have no idea why! Hope this was helpful - sorry for being so long-winded!
Posts.Title: Taxotere and watery eyes npaynerieger npaynerieger

Posts.Content: Mar 9, 2015 08:27PM SusanAnn wrote: Hi everyone! Not sure what the insurance companies are basing their approval on???? I am currently in the Phase 3 trial of Palbo/Faslodex and have been for over a year. Before that I was on Arimidex for approx. two and a half years before I had progression! Babs very happy to hear that you got approved and my best wishes that it works well for you! Are you taking just Ibrance or is your Onc. giving you another drug with it?
